name: Vicki L. Hanson
content: Vicki Hanson Vicki Hanson has been working on issues of inclusion for older adults and disabled people throughout her career, first as a Postdoctoral Fellow at the Salk Institute for Biological Studies, and later at the IBM Research Division in 1986 and then as a Professor at the University of Dundee in Scotland and the Rochester Institute of Technology in New York. Significant recognition Elected Member of the National Academy of Engineering, 2020 Distinguished Alumni, University of Oregon, July, 2017 Honorary Doctor of Science, Newcastle University, July, 2017 President, ACM (Association for Computing Machinery), 2016 – 2018 ACM CHI Academy, May, 2017 Visiting Professor, Digital Science Institute, Lancaster University, 2017 Fellow, Royal Society of Edinburgh, 2013 Fellow, ACM, 2004 Fellow CITP, British Computer Society, 2009 Royal Society Wolfson Research Merit Award, 2009 Outstanding Contributions to Computing and Accessibility Award, ACM SIGACCESS, 2014 Anita Borg Woman of Vision Award for Social Impact, 2013 Notable Women in Computing” Playing Cards – Ace of Clubs, see https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jessidg/notable-women-in-computing-card-deck/posts/1060182 Share this: Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook RESEARCH INTERESTS Human-computer interaction Accessibility Computing education: Ethical inclusion of students with disabilities Aging Applications addressing needs of diverse populations, with emphasis on language, cognition, and healthcare Vicki Hanson Sign up Log in Copy shortlink Report this content Manage subscriptions
